elements.name: Q111
elements.title: Exterior Photos
Take photos of the accessible parking spaces.
elements.name: Q113

elements.title: Take a photo of the front of the building.
elements.name: Q114

elements.title: Take photos of all exterior signage.
elements.name: Q112

elements.title: Take a photo of the address number on the subject property.
elements.name: Q109

elements.title: Take a photo of the posted operating hours and after hours phone number.
elements.name: Q115
Q153
elements.title: Parking
Is there parking adequate and close by?
elements.name: Q42

elements.title: Does your facility provide one accessible parking space per 25 total parking spaces?
elements.name: Q43

elements.title: Is at least one van-accessible parking space available per every one to 25 total spaces?
elements.name: Q44

elements.title: Is the parking space clearly marked by the International Symbol of Access?
elements.name: Q58

elements.title: If only street parking is available, is there an unobstructed curb cut/ramp?
elements.name: Q45

elements.title: If the accessible route crosses a curb, is a curb ramp provided?
elements.name: Q59

elements.title: Is the ramp at least 36 inches wide?
elements.name: Q60
Q154
elements.title: General Information
Do/can you provide alternative appointment scheduling for those who need extra time?
elements.name: Q53

elements.title: Are members' rights to file a grievance visually posted?
elements.name: Q54

elements.title: Is there a policy and procedure document that states what to do in case of emergency?
elements.name: Q57

elements.title: Take a photo of the emergency policy and procedure document.
elements.name: Q121
Q62
elements.title: Building Entrance
Is the exterior entry door at least 32 inches wide and does it open at least 90 degrees?
elements.name: Q43

elements.title: Does the entrance door have handles that can be opened without grasping, pinching or twisting of the wrist?
elements.name: Q44
Q155
elements.title: Interior Route
Are all interior travel route paths at least 36 inches wide?
elements.name: Q46

elements.title: Is the route stable, firm and slip-resistant?
elements.name: Q47

elements.title: Is the route clear of any free object that may stick out?
elements.name: Q48

elements.title: Is the interior door leading from waiting room to other interior rooms at least 32 inches wide and does it open at least 90 degrees?
elements.name: Q49

elements.title: Does the facility have an elevator?
elements.name: Q50

elements.title: Do  the sliding doors reopen automatically when obstructed by an object?  (Note: If constructed before March 15, 2012, and manually operated, the door is not required to reopen automatically.)
elements.name: Q134

elements.title: Are the call buttons no higher than 54 inches from the floor?
elements.name: Q135

elements.title: Are the in-car buttons no higher than 48 inches from the floor?
elements.name: Q136

elements.title: Do the elevators provide audible signal indicators and or Braille signage?
elements.name: Q137

elements.title: Are there audible signals when the elevator car passes or stops at a floor?
elements.name: Q138
Q58
elements.title: Waiting Room Area
Is there an open space at least 36 inches wide by 48 inches long in the waiting area to accommodate a wheelchair?
elements.name: Q60

elements.title: Does the reception area accommodate at least 1.5 seats per number of patients scheduled each hour?
elements.name: Q61

elements.title: Take a photo of the waiting area.  (Make you do not capture any patients in the image.)
elements.name: Q124
Q156
elements.title: Restrooms

Does the restroom entry configuration provide adequate maneuvering space for a person using a wheelchair? (Needs 36" of clear width for forward movement and a five-foot diameter or T-shaped clear space to make turns.  If entry vestibule has two doors, a minimum distance of 48" clear of the door swing between the two doors.)
elements.name: Q63

elements.title: In restrooms without stalls, is there at least 30"X48" area of open floor space clear of the door swing?
elements.name: Q64

elements.title: Is the side-wall grab bar at least 42 inches long?
elements.name: Q65

elements.title: Is the rear-wall grab bar at least 36 inches long?
elements.name: Q66

elements.title: Is the toilet paper dispenser no greater than 48 inches above the floor below the side-wall grab bar?
elements.name: Q67

elements.title: Is there at least one accessible sink that provides enough space for wheelchair users to park in front of the sink (30"W X 48"L)?
elements.name: Q68

elements.title: Is the faucet handle operable without needing to grasp, twist or pinch?
elements.name: Q69

elements.title: Are the soap and towel dispensers (or hand-driers) within reach (i.e., no higher than 48" from the floor) and not over an obstruction?
elements.name: Q70

elements.title: Take at least one photo of the restroom, capturing the accessibility features (rear-wall grab bar, side-wall grab bar, sink, etc.)
elements.name: Q122
Q157
elements.title: Exam Rooms
Is the entry door to the exam room at least 32 inches wide?
elements.name: Q71

elements.title: Is there adequate space for a mobility device to make a 180-degree turn (i.e., at least 30" X 48") on one side of the exam table?
elements.name: Q72

elements.title: Are there private changing areas that are accessible?
elements.name: Q73

elements.title: Are gowns and drapes provided?
elements.name: Q74

elements.title: Take a photo of the exam room (only if not in use/occupied by a patient).
elements.name: Q123
Q125
elements.title: Additional Interior Photos

Take photos of the interior of the facility.  The photos should be representational of the facility and include, but not be limited to:  interior signage, posted operating hours/after hours phone number, offices, reception area, employee break room, x-ray room, lab, conference room, storage area).
elements.name: Q128
Q130
elements.title: Equipment/Scales

Is there a weight scale that can accommodate wheelchairs or people who are unable to stand without assistance, which is either integrated into a patient lift, integrated into an exam table or has a platform?
elements.name: Q78

elements.title: Does the office have or can your office adapt an exam table for accessible transfers of people who use a wheelchair or are unable to transfer without assistance?  (This may include the use of an adjustable-height table, transfer board, portable lift or a stretcher/gurney.)
elements.name: Q79
Q141
elements.title: Accommodations

Does the office have the ability to accommodate members with hearing, speech and sight disabilities?  (The following materials are examples of accommodations: paper/writing utensil, visual aids, written materials, assistive-listening devices or systems and access to qualified sign language interpreters.)
elements.name: Q80

elements.title: Are translation services available in a minimum of 150 languages (such as an oral interpretation vendor)?
elements.name: Q119
Q143
elements.title: ADA
Do  staff members or designated leader receive ADA training once a year?
elements.name: Q81
Q144
elements.title: Plans, Policies and Licensure
Is there a hazardous materials/waste policy that describes the storage of sterile needles and proper disposal of used needles?
elements.name: Q83

elements.title: Is there an exposure-control process that includes infections control and universal precautions policies, procedures or protocols?
elements.name: Q84

elements.title: Does the office have a Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) certificate and/or waiver?
elements.name: Q85

elements.title: CLIA certificate number:
elements.name: Q116

elements.title: Certificate date:
elements.name: Q115

elements.title: Certificate expiration date:
elements.name: Q114

elements.title: Take photo(s) of the CLIA certificate and/or waiver.
elements.name: Q141

elements.title: Does the office have an automated prescription writing tool that ensures the following list of abbreviations, acronyms, symbols and dose designations are not used?  The list must include: U,u; IU; Q.D., QD, q.d., qd, Q.O.D., QOD, q.o.d., qod; Trailing zero (x.o mg); Lack of leading zero (.xmg); MS; MSO4; MgSO4
elements.name: Q94

elements.title: Are procedures in place  to review prescriptions for accuracy prior to giving to patients or sending to pharmacies?
elements.name: Q145

elements.title: Does the office label all medications and medication containers (e.g., syringes, basins) to identify the contents?
elements.name: Q96

elements.title: Are all medications stored and maintained in an area away from public access and in an area, cabinet or room that can be securely locked? If no medications currently stored in office is there a policy that addresses medication storage if ever needed?
elements.name: Q97

elements.title: Is there a 24-hour answering service or machine instructing members about how to obtain care?
elements.name: Q98

elements.title: Are your office hours and after-hours phone number posted internally and externally? (NOTE:  May be "N/A" only if the office is located in large building and outside posting is prohibited by building management.)
elements.name: Q99

elements.title: Take photos of any policies and procedures verified above and any licenses or permits held by the practitioner(s).
elements.name: Q129
Q100
elements.title: Medical Records

elements.name: Q101
elements.text: NOTE:  For initial credentialing and re-credentialing, the reviewer must evaluate one blinded medical record to assess the adequacy of medical-record-keeping practices.
elements.value: NOTE:  For initial credentialing and re-credentialing, the reviewer must evaluate one blinded medical record to assess the adequacy of medical-record-keeping practices.

elements.title: Are medical records maintained in an area away from public access?
elements.name: Q101

elements.title: Is a Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)-compliant written authorization obtained from the member or the member's authorized representative for maintaining the release of medical records?  (Ask to see policy and procedure and the release form.)
elements.name: Q102

elements.title: Take a photo of the HIPAA policy and procedure.
elements.name: Q119

elements.title: Take a photo of the HIPAA release form.
elements.name: Q134

elements.title: Is there a mechanism for tracking referrals and reports to and from other practitioners and providers (e.g., between a primary care physician and a specialist)?
elements.name: Q107

elements.title: Is there evidence that medical record documentation standards have been implemented (e.g., legible, clear, concise, consistent, complete)?
elements.name: Q103

elements.title: Is there prominent documentation in an individual's record regarding execution of an advance directive?
elements.name: Q104

elements.title: Is there a policy/procedure that outlines anti-discrimination in health care delivery? (Ask to see policy.)
elements.name: Q105

elements.title: Take a photo of the anti-discrimination policy/procedure document.
elements.name: Q121
Q140
elements.title: Overall Assessment
On inspection, is the office functionally safe and sanitary?
elements.name: Q139
Q109
elements.text: Is there an appointment available for:
elements.value: Is there an appointment available for:

elements.title: Complete physical exam, routine preventive health, or well-child visits within 21 to 30 calendar days?
elements.name: Q114

elements.title: Symptomatic visit within seven calendar days?
elements.name: Q115

elements.title: Specialty care within 21 working days?
elements.name: Q116

elements.title: Urgent visit  for an established patient within 24 hours?
elements.name: Q117

elements.title: Emergent visit with an established patient as soon as possible (i.e., immediately)?
elements.name: Q118

elements.title: Do physicians see patients within 15 to 30 minutes of scheduled appointments?
elements.name: Q122
Q140
